alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia; Inland Volusia; Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 4:52PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Seminole and Volusia Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 452 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near DeLand Airport, or 7 miles northeast of DeLand, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Deltona, Daytona Beach, Port Orange, Sanford, and Ormond Beach. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
